content.text: For what is the multiverse but a kaleidoscopic maelstrom of potentialities colliding and never colliding, like a thousand chess games played upon boards that dissolve into clouds of ink mid-move, only to reform into trees that grow sideways through time!
A mathematical abstraction, encoded and immortalized as a mere entry on the universal blockchain, an algorithmic breath trapped within the infinite, unyielding ledger of existence!
For if the soul is but a database record, a meticulously hashed line of cosmic code, then what of free will? What of consciousness, of morality, of choice?

Are we not then mere transactions, each thought, each action, a proof-of-stake in the grand computation of the almighty? And does this ledger, this divine blockchain, not record every impulse, every decision, with cold precision, awaiting validation by some higher nodeâ€”some omniscient miner beyond our comprehension?
The wobbly chairs of the universe, where every quantum bit is both up and down.
